intro: Leucanthemella serotina, commonly known as the late yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its yellow ray florets contrast with the darker central disk, making it visually distinctive. Leucanthemella serotina blooms in late summer to early fall, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
